member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingAttribute

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingAttribute.LoggingFields
member.summary: Specifies what fields to log.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingAttribute.IsRequestBodyLogLimitSet
member.summary: Indicates whether has been set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingAttribute.RequestBodyLogLimit
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of bytes to be logged for the request body.
member.exception: Thrown when set to a value less than 0.
Thrown when getting if it hasn't been set to a value. Check first.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingAttribute.IsResponseBodyLogLimitSet
member.summary: Indicates whether has been set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingAttribute.ResponseBodyLogLimit
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of bytes to be logged for the response body.
member.exception: Thrown when set to a value less than 0.
Thrown when getting if it hasn't been set to a value. Check first.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields
member.summary: Flags used to control which parts of the request and response are logged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.None
member.summary: No logging.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestPath
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Request Path, which includes both the and .
For example: Path: /index PathBase: /app

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestQuery
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Request .
For example: Query: ?index=1
RequestQuery contents can contain private information which may have regulatory concerns under GDPR and other laws. RequestQuery should not be logged unless logs are secure and access controlled and the privacy impact assessed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestProtocol
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Request .
For example: Protocol: HTTP/1.1

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestMethod
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Request .
For example: Method: GET

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestScheme
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Request .
For example: Scheme: https

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.ResponseStatusCode
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Response .
For example: StatusCode: 200

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestHeaders
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Request . Request Headers are logged as soon as the middleware is invoked. Headers are redacted by default with the character '[Redacted]' unless specified in the .
For example: Connection: keep-alive My-Custom-Request-Header: [Redacted]

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.ResponseHeaders
member.summary:
Flag for logging the HTTP Response . Response Headers are logged when the is written to or when is called.
Headers are redacted by default with the character '[Redacted]' unless specified in the .
For example: Content-Length: 16 My-Custom-Response-Header: [Redacted]

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestTrailers
member.summary: Flag for logging the HTTP Request . Request Trailers are currently not logged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.ResponseTrailers
member.summary: Flag for logging the HTTP Response . Response Trailers are currently not logged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestBody
member.summary: Flag for logging the HTTP Request . Logging the request body has performance implications, as it requires buffering the entire request body up to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.ResponseBody
member.summary: Flag for logging the HTTP Response . Logging the response body has performance implications, as it requires buffering the entire response body up to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.Duration
member.summary: Flag for logging how long it took to process the request and response in milliseconds.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestProperties
member.summary: Flag for logging a collection of HTTP Request properties, including , , , and .
member.remarks: The HTTP Request is not included with this flag as it may contain private information. If desired, it should be explicitly specified with .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.RequestPropertiesAndHeaders
member.summary: Flag for logging HTTP Request properties and headers. Includes and
member.remarks: The HTTP Request is not included with this flag as it may contain private information. If desired, it should be explicitly specified with .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.ResponsePropertiesAndHeaders
member.summary: Flag for logging HTTP Response properties and headers. Includes and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.Request
member.summary: Flag for logging the entire HTTP Request. Includes and . Logging the request body has performance implications, as it requires buffering the entire request body up to .
member.remarks: The HTTP Request is not included with this flag as it may contain private information. If desired, it should be explicitly specified with .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.Response
member.summary: Flag for logging the entire HTTP Response. Includes and . Logging the response body has performance implications, as it requires buffering the entire response body up to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields.All
member.summary: Flag for logging both the HTTP Request and Response. Includes , , and . Logging the request and response body has performance implications, as it requires buffering the entire request and response body up to the and .
member.remarks: The HTTP Request is not included with this flag as it may contain private information. If desired, it should be explicitly specified with .

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext
member.summary: The context used for .
member.remarks:
Settings will be pre-initialized with the relevant values from and updated with endpoint specific values from or . All settings can be modified per request. All settings will carry over from
to except the which are cleared after logging the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.HttpContext
member.summary: The request context.
member.remarks: This property should not be set by user code except for testing purposes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.LoggingFields
member.summary: Gets or sets which parts of the request and response to log.
member.remarks: This is pre-populated with the value from , , or .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.RequestBodyLogLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of bytes of the request body to log.
member.remarks: This is pre-populated with the value from , , or .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.ResponseBodyLogLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of bytes of the response body to log.
member.remarks: This is pre-populated with the value from , , or .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a list of parameters that will be logged as part of the request or response. Values specified in will be added automatically after all interceptors run. All values are cleared after logging the request. All other relevant settings will carry over to the response.
member.remarks: If is enabled, the parameters will be logged as part of the combined log.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds data that will be logged as part of the request or response. See .

member.summary: Adds the given fields to what's currently enabled in .

member.summary: Checks if any of the given fields are currently enabled in .
member.param: One or more field flags to check.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.Disable(Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields)
member.summary: Removes the given fields from what's currently enabled in .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext.TryDisable(Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingFields)
member.summary: Disables the given fields if any are currently enabled in .
member.param: One or more field flags to disable if present.
member.returns: if any of the fields were previously enabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingMiddleware
member.summary: Middleware that logs HTTP requests and HTTP responses.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions
member.summary: Options for the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions.LoggingFields
member.summary: Fields to log for the Request and Response. Defaults to logging request and response properties and headers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions.RequestHeaders
member.summary:
Request header values that are allowed to be logged.
If a request header is not present in the , the header name will be logged with a redacted value. Request headers can contain authentication tokens, or private information which may have regulatory concerns under GDPR and other laws. Arbitrary request headers should not be logged unless logs are secure and access controlled and the privacy impact assessed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions.ResponseHeaders
member.summary:
Response header values that are allowed to be logged.
If a response header is not present in the , the header name will be logged with a redacted value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions.MediaTypeOptions
member.summary:
Options for configuring encodings for a specific media type.
If the request or response do not match the supported media type, the response body will not be logged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions.RequestBodyLogLimit
member.summary: Maximum request body size to log (in bytes). Defaults to 32 KB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions.ResponseBodyLogLimit
member.summary: Maximum response body size to log (in bytes). Defaults to 32 KB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingOptions.CombineLogs
member.summary: Gets or sets if the middleware will combine the request, request body, response, response body, and duration logs into a single log entry. The default is .

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.IHttpLoggingInterceptor
member.summary: Callbacks used to extend the HttpLogging middleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.IHttpLoggingInterceptor.OnRequestAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext)
member.summary: A callback to customize the logging of the request and response.
member.remarks: This is called when the request is first received and can be used to configure both request and response options. All settings will carry over to except the will be cleared after logging the request. may be changed per request to control the logging behavior. If no request fields are enabled, and the collection is empty, no request logging will occur. If is enabled then will carry over from the request to response and be logged together.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.IHttpLoggingInterceptor.OnResponseAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.HttpLoggingInterceptorContext)
member.summary: A callback to customize the logging of the response.
member.remarks: This is called when the first write to the response happens, or the response ends without a write, just before anything is sent to the client. Settings are carried over from (except the ) and response settings may still be modified. Changes to request settings will have no effect. If no response fields are enabled, and the collection is empty, no response logging will occur. If is enabled then will carry over from the request to response and be logged together. and can also be disabled in OnResponseAsync to prevent logging any buffered body data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.ISystemDateTime.Now
member.summary: Retrieves the date and time currently set for this machine.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.MediaTypeOptions
member.summary: Options for HttpLogging to configure which encoding to use for each media type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions
member.summary: Options for the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions.FileSizeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a strictly positive value representing the maximum log size in bytes or null for no limit. Once the log is full, no more messages will be appended. Defaults to 10MiB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions.RetainedFileCountLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a strictly positive value representing the maximum retained file count. Defaults to 4. Must be between 1 and 10,000, inclusive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string representing the prefix of the file name used to store the logging information. The current date plus a file number (in the format {YYYYMMDD.X} will be appended to the given value. Defaults to w3clog-.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions.LogDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets a string representing the directory where the log file will be written to. Defaults to ./logs/ relative to the app directory (ContentRoot). If a full path is given, that full path will be used. If a relative path is given, the full path will be that path relative to ContentRoot.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions.FlushInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the period after which logs will be flushed to the store. Defaults to 1 second.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions.AdditionalRequestHeaders
member.summary:
List of additional request header values to log.
Request headers can contain authentication tokens, or private information which may have regulatory concerns under GDPR and other laws. Arbitrary request headers should not be logged unless logs are secure and access controlled and the privacy impact assessed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggerOptions.LoggingFields
member.summary: Fields to log. Defaults to logging request and response properties and headers, plus date/time info and server name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggingFields
member.summary: Flags used to control which parts of the request and response are logged in W3C format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggingFields.None

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggingFields.Time
member.summary: Flag for logging the time that the activity occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpLogging.W3CLoggingFields.ClientIpAddress

member.summary: Flag for logging the name of the authenticated user that accessed the server. UserName contents can contain private information which may have regulatory concerns under GDPR and other laws. UserName should not be logged unless logs are secure and access controlled and the privacy impact assessed.

member.summary: Flag for logging the IP address of the server on which the log entry was generated.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm
member.summary: Provides support for efficiently using Tasks to implement the APM (Begin/End) pattern.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.Begin(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Marshals the Task as an IAsyncResult, using the supplied callback and state to implement the APM pattern.
member.param: The callback to be invoked upon completion.
The state to be stored in the IAsyncResult.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult to represent the task's asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.End(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Processes an IAsyncResult returned by Begin.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.End``1(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Processes an IAsyncResult returned by Begin.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult
member.summary: Provides a simple IAsyncResult that wraps a Task.
member.remarks: We could use the Task as the IAsyncResult if the Task's AsyncState is the same as the object state, but that's very rare, in particular in a situation where someone cares about allocation, and always using TaskAsyncResult simplifies things and enables additional optimizations.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult._task
member.summary: The wrapped Task.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult._callback
member.summary: Callback to invoke when the wrapped task completes.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Object,System.AsyncCallback)
member.summary: Initializes the IAsyncResult with the Task to wrap and the associated object state.
member.param: Callback to invoke when the wrapped task completes.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.InvokeCallback
member.summary: Invokes the callback.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.AsyncState
member.summary: Gets a user-defined object that qualifies or contains information about an asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.CompletedSynchronously
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the asynchronous operation completed synchronously.
member.remarks: This is set lazily based on whether the has completed by the time this object is created.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the asynchronous operation has completed.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.AsyncWaitHandle
member.summary: Gets a that is used to wait for an asynchronous operation to complete.

member.name: P:System.IO.Pipelines.BufferSegment.End
member.summary: The End represents the offset into AvailableMemory where the range of "active" bytes ends. At the point when the block is leased the End is guaranteed to be equal to Start. The value of Start may be assigned anywhere between 0 and Buffer.Length, and must be equal to or less than End.

member.name: P:System.IO.Pipelines.BufferSegment.NextSegment
member.summary: Reference to the next block of data when the overall "active" bytes spans multiple blocks. At the point when the block is leased Next is guaranteed to be null. Start, End, and Next are used together in order to create a linked-list of discontiguous working memory. The "active" memory is grown when bytes are copied in, End is increased, and Next is assigned. The "active" memory is shrunk when bytes are consumed, Start is increased, and blocks are returned to the pool.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipelines.BufferSegmentStack.SegmentAsValueType
member.summary: A simple struct we wrap reference types inside when storing in arrays to bypass the CLR's covariant checks when writing to arrays.
member.remarks: We use as a wrapper to avoid paying the cost of covariant checks whenever the underlying array that the class uses is written to. We've recognized this as a perf win in ETL traces for these stack frames: clr!JIT_Stelem_Ref clr!ArrayStoreCheck clr!ObjIsInstanceOf

member.name: M:System.Text.ValueStringBuilder.GetPinnableReference
member.summary: Get a pinnable reference to the builder. Does not ensure there is a null char after This overload is pattern matched in the C# 7.3+ compiler so you can omit the explicit method call, and write eg "fixed (char* c = builder)"

member.name: M:System.Text.ValueStringBuilder.GetPinnableReference(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a pinnable reference to the builder.
member.param: Ensures that the builder has a null char after

member.name: P:System.Text.ValueStringBuilder.RawChars
member.summary: Returns the underlying storage of the builder.

member.name: M:System.Text.ValueStringBuilder.AsSpan(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a span around the contents of the builder.
member.param: Ensures that the builder has a null char after

member.name: M:System.Text.ValueStringBuilder.Grow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resize the internal buffer either by doubling current buffer size or by adding to whichever is greater.
member.param: Number of chars requested beyond current position.
